page.title: 12Bilingualism & Heol-y-Cyw.
page.content: The policy of bilingual road signs has caused much discussion in this village. Most people believe that towns etc. should be known by their Welsh names but admit that bilingual signs would be advantageous for those visiting, especially when the places are commonly known by their English names. However where places have always been known by their Welsh name they see no need for bilingual signs. {Who would recognise Fairfield as the {town always known as Maesteg? } Corruption of many words has changed the original meaning of many place names. The literal translation of place names are,in some cases, offensive to the inhabitants. Heol-y-Cyw is one such place and efforts are being made to trace the origin of the name. (Group A.) S.G.
